Reviews.Title: It works, but not perfect.
Reviews.Author: Stephen F Grande
Reviews.Content: I am using 4 of these and would order more of them if I have a problem with any future Foscam FI8910 that I purchase. The Foscams that were at the greatest distance from my WiFi hub were unreliable with the video going in and out unpredictably. By switching out the short antenna to these expanders I got reliable video from all my Foscams using them. However, i still have problems sending pan and scan control signals to those cameras. They respond, but slowly and not to ever command that I send. At least once I get them aimed properly they deliver a reliable video signal with these Antenna Expanders which they did not do without them.

Reviews.Title: Does not boost signal reception
Reviews.Author: D. Chen
Reviews.Content: I bought this because I was having horrible wireless quality with my foscam FI8910W. From what they recommended to me, the better antenna should fix the problem. I tried it and nope, it does absolutely nothing. There is no difference between this one and the 3dbi antenna that comes with the foscam. Very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: Seriously this thing can't even hold its self upright.
Reviews.Author: KFK
Reviews.Content: Its Big..way bigger than the stock foscam antenna..but it can't even hold its self upright..it just rotates to point downward...may not be an issue for you..but it was for me due to how my camera was mounted on the wall.

Reviews.Title: this unit DOES NOT FIT the FI8904 without modifications
Reviews.Author: David Viola
Reviews.Content: Connector only designed to work with Foscam Indoor models such as 18919w and NOT outdoor FI8904/5 models!!! Why is this being recommended for all Foscam IP cameras when I specifically searched for criteria to work on F18904w???

Reviews.Title: Boosted camera range and seemed to improve video
Reviews.Author: Mark Shapiro "mshapiro123"
Reviews.Content: I installed this on a Foscam wireless IP camera that I'm using as a baby monitor.  The signal strength and speed of the video is excellent even though the camera is on a different floor and on the far side of the house, thus must broadcast through several walls and the floor.  I would have given it five stars, but the antenna joint at the ferrule is unstable and the antenna must be propped up as it won't stay vertical on it's own.

Reviews.Title: Does what its supposed to do.
Reviews.Author: Roger Hagon
Reviews.Content: Does a good job extending the range from our house to the barn where we have located our Foscam F18910W. The only problem we have had with it is keeping it screwed on tight enough so it doesn't tip over.

Reviews.Title: It works good ...
Reviews.Author: Richard Boyd
Reviews.Content: I put one of these 9dbi antennas on a little Foscam camera that was not far from the router (maybe 15 ft), but transmits through a couple thick walls. The little 3dbi antenna that came with the camera was not hacking it. Movement was slow and choppy, video buffering and refresh was constant. I put this big antenna on the camera and it works a lot better now. Instant response and no buffering.The antenna is big, and looks a little goofy on my camera, but the increase in performance is worth it. A nice, easy, and inexpensive solution. Much better, and way cheaper, than buying and installing an amplifier or wireless range extender.I'd recommend this antenna for use in situations where you can communicate with your camera, but the picture and movement don't work well.If you are not even able to communicate with your camera, then a passive antenna my not improve things much. Perhaps in that case you will need a powered amplifier in addition to one of these antennas. Every situation is different. May need to experiment a little bit.

Reviews.Title: did not help
Reviews.Author: lrrp246 "lrrp"
Reviews.Content: did not help still loose signal only 40 ft away from trainmitter. I got to get closer to units to make it work

Reviews.Title: Horrible
Reviews.Author: William H Nussman
Reviews.Content: Too floppy to stay up.  Doesn't boost signal at all.  The standard antenna that came with the camera is better.

Reviews.Title: Better than stock antennas
Reviews.Author: awsum140
Reviews.Content: I bought this antenna to use with an IP camera.  The original antenna that came with the camera was a piece of junk that broke while installing it.  This one is a little more "robust" but still needs to be treated with care when adjusting its position.  It does seem to have better gain, signal strength, but the added length can be a problem.  Overall, a decent replacement with a better signal.

Reviews.Title: Does NOT fit the F18905E
Reviews.Author: E. Boggs "E. Boggs"
Reviews.Content: I have the camera on the corner of the house.  I'm only getting .5 fps with 23 kb receiving at my router.  HORRIBLE.  I bought this antenna to try and get a stronger wireless signal.  The antenna will NOT fit the camera.  The lock-down ring is too big for the camera antenna mounting hole.  So, you get "NO SIGNAL".  I wiggled and finagled the connection and got it to "touch" enough to transmit a signal and I rocketed to 3 fps with 70 kb, still not enough to capture anything that walked through the vision of the camera unless they stopped in front of the camera.This was a total waste of money.  This antenna is billed as a "fit" for the outdoor cameras but that is a crock!Do NOT buy this antenna for the outdoor cameras.  It will only fit the indoor cameras.

Reviews.Title: Must Buy It... No Choice
Reviews.Author: Dustin
Reviews.Content: If you want to PROPERLY use your Foscam camera... you basically have to buy this in order to get it to truly work from even a short distance. After replacing my antenna with this one, all PTZ features worked perfectly.

Reviews.Title: A complete waste of time and money.
Reviews.Author: dec42905 "Denise"
Reviews.Content: I have two wireless Foscam cameras on my detached garage.  With the standard antenna, the cameras would sporadically drop out due to a weak signal.  I ordered one of these antennas with the hope that it would help strengthen the signal.  In reality, the antenna didn't work at all on either camera.  I lost what little signal I had to begin with.  The quality of the antenna is very poor.  The connector doesn't fit the camera properly and the joint is not strong enough to support it's own weight.I cured the signal issue using an infrastructure solution.  Two extra strength access points in client bridge mode.Bottom line, don't waste your time or money as this product was a huge disappointment.

Reviews.Title: The product is not a silver bullet for a wireless cam with low reception.
Reviews.Author: Edrick P.
Reviews.Content: I bough this antenna to help improve the reception of a Foscam wireless camera on a low reception area at home. It didn't help. I recommend working on improving your wireless signal instead (by changing or moving your router or adding another router closer that works on bridge mode).

Reviews.Title: Big, but does extend the range
Reviews.Author: W. Bender
Reviews.Content: This antenna is about 16" long, but it does seem to do what it is supposed to. It looks a bit weird attached to the camera because it is long, But as far as I can tell it works pretty good. I have some Foscam FI8910 W cameras. I set one up in a steel pole barn with a fiberglass garage door. I couldn't get it to couple with my router in the house with the standard antenna. I put this antenna on and bingo it connected right away. I don't think it can punch through steel and the fiberglass door helps I'm sure, but still, the standard antenna wouldn't get there and this one does. I can't speak to how far it will extend the range and there are a lot of factors that can impact that, but I am convinced that it will get you farther than the standard antenna.I plan on trying some experimenting this coming Summer with an outdoor camera to see just how far it will extend the range line of sight.I will just add that among the various factors that can impact wireless range, other wireless traffic in the area can be the biggest one to cause problems. Sometimes different channels work better than others. This antenna will not solve all problems by any means, but it should help. Whether or not it is enough can not be predicted reliably. Your specific set of conditions means a lot. Sometimes you can also get high gain antennas for your router too. These might even fit depending on the connector. Keep in mind that increasing the range of your router also makes your router more vulnerable to being intercepted. Use security.

Reviews.Title: Maybe just the Foscam camera at fault. . .
Reviews.Author: AFSDMS Pro User Reviews
Reviews.Content: I got these in a package deal with 2 F18910W cameras. (Direct from FOSCAM was a better deal all around.) I have tried them at several different distances for each of two Linksys/Cisco routers. Channels have been optimized relative to other signals in vicinity. (Using Android App WiFi "Analyzer" from Farproc and "inSIDer" on notebook PC.)Moved camera with the stock "low gain" antenna to point where it just cannot connect and then switched to "9 dBi" antenna. Still unable to connect even after restart. From this same point my notebook has no problem connecting to WiFi.It may be due to other signals but the notebook has no problem. Next solution to provide service to them is thru a pair of 14 dBi directional patch antennas on the router to service the camera sites. After that it may be CAT5E cable.

Reviews.Title: Does not fit and falls over
Reviews.Author: R. Caplan
Reviews.Content: I bought 2 of these but can't even use them. They cannot screw onto the back of my Foscam 8904 because the nut is too big to fit into the opening to attach the antenna. it only screws in one turn and does not connect. And, then it falls over too. big disappointment.Update: After Dremelling to remove almost all of the plastic around the nut, I managed to screw it in far enough to make contact, and got it to work - sitting right next to the wireless router.When I move the camera not even 40', it loses connection. This thing is not even as good as the short, stock antenna, which DOES work from the same spot.If I could give this thing ZERO stars, I would. Double bummer is that I bought two of these, and even paid for expedited shipping. Complete loss of almost $50!

Reviews.Title: Can't Support Itself
Reviews.Author: MC "MC"
Reviews.Content: This is so poorly made that it can't even stand up straight. Falls over and seems like it doesn't even make a good connection to the camera. Don't waste your money.

Reviews.Title: Too heavy, won't tighten....won't stand up on it's own! Terrible product!
Reviews.Author: cwilli
Reviews.Content: Totally useless! Won't tighten or stand up straight on it's own. I have 9 camera's and wanted to extend the range.  Bought 6....threw 6 in the trash! Horrible product!

Reviews.Title: Opticron binocular tripod mount  - excellent
Reviews.Author: John Jones
Reviews.Content: The subject item was exactly as described and has performed perfectly. The delivery was timely and the price reasonable.  I would buy this item with no concern.  If this review is rejected, as most of mine are, I will place my future reviews on tech republic or related blogs instead.

Reviews.Title: Don't like it, did not use it
Reviews.Author: Kwesi
Reviews.Content: Unnecessary. Also, it will not stand up on it's own when attached to my Foscam FI9826 camera. It will always fall over. Useless. The small antenna that comes with the camera works just fine.

Reviews.Title: The antenna is so heavy, it rotates and flops
Reviews.Author: Arvada
Reviews.Content: The antenna is so large that it swivels and falls hanging to the side.  It does do its job however.

Reviews.Title: Works as Advertised
Reviews.Author: Teddi
Reviews.Content: I have a camera in a covered, outdoor location that is at the outer limit of the 3dbi antenna. Reception was hit and miss. I switched out the original antenna for the 9dbi  replacement and the camera now works great.  Great low cost solution.

Reviews.Title: Works a treat, has trouble staying up.
Reviews.Author: Thalia, Euphrosyne, and Aglaea
Reviews.Content: The antenna itself greatly improved the wireless range, but it doesn't stay straight up on it's own. We hooked it to something else to keep it upright.

Reviews.Title: its ok, didn't seem to make much of a difference
Reviews.Author: Wesley Schott
Reviews.Content: I didn't notice a difference with this antenna installed compared to what came with the foscam camera originally, maybe my expectations were too high

Reviews.Title: Doesn't really work for me
Reviews.Author: jj
Reviews.Content: Should have just hard wired it to my router. The booster doesn't really add any distance and the camera is only 50ft from my wifi.

Reviews.Title: 9dbi antenna
Reviews.Author: L-Con
Reviews.Content: I cannot say whether or not this antenna performs or not as I purchased it for a Uniden GC45 camera.  It does not fit.  This antenna has a male center pin in the connector where the Uniden antenna has a female center pin.

Reviews.Title: It does work
Reviews.Author: Gerald E Patterson
Reviews.Content: I installed this on a Foscam FI9821W camera located about 50 ft away from my router.  There are three walls between the antenna and router.  The 3dbi antenna that came with the unit wouldn't work at all but after installing the 9dbi antenna its working fine.  I also installed this outside under the eve of the house.  Its been outside for a couple of weeks now and no problems to date.

Reviews.Title: Nice signal boost
Reviews.Author: James Davis
Reviews.Content: Beware, does not plug and play with Foscam outdoor cameras. You will need an adapter. But works well. once you get it installed.  IP wireless camera maintains better signal. Also, looks very impressive.

Reviews.Title: Will not fit intended Foscam camera
Reviews.Author: Clois Chitwood
Reviews.Content: The antenna was ordered to extend the range of a FI8904W camera previously ordered but will not work for this camera.  The online info did not differentiate between the needs of this camera from other Foscam cameras.

Reviews.Title: Antenna extender
Reviews.Author: Stephen A. Walker
Reviews.Content: I purchased 2 9dbi antenna extenders and am happy with my purchase. They work as advertised and have extended my range on my cameras to about 135 ft from my router. I only had about 50 ft. before. I would recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: WORKS GREAT!!!!
Reviews.Author: NEfanman
Reviews.Content: had a 8905w camera with a smaller antenna that kept losing its signal.  I have a ip camera further away with a larger antenna that works fine.  bought this and screwed onto the back of camera and I have had no issues since.  Is big as other reviewers state, but I want attention to my camera as a deterrent and most importantly it now works!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Wasted money! Does nothing.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: No difference in this antenna and the stock antenna. Well except the 9dbi antenna does not want to stay vertical.

Reviews.Title: Simple solid fix
Reviews.Author: Dave-by-the-Beach "DitW"
Reviews.Content: Superman has trouble seeing through lead. I had a camera with problems connecting through a couple of walls, but it was right on the ragged edge. This antenna made the connection rock solid. That was easy...

Reviews.Title: Plastic threads strip out easily
Reviews.Author: Stan
Reviews.Content: The threads are plastic and strip out easily. Didn't get much gain either. I got them quick. I didn't try to contact the seller, I just lived with it.

Reviews.Title: works great
Reviews.Author: jim owen
Reviews.Content: needed the extra distance for an outside camera and this extended the signal the extra fifty feet. Seems to work good

Reviews.Title: didn't work
Reviews.Author: SMOPizza
Reviews.Content: have an indoor camera, added an outdoor camera that was 20 ft away from WIFI router,still did not get decent signal, had to hard wire the camera.contact me if you want to buy this one, but would not expect it to work

Reviews.Title: Works but....
Reviews.Author: A & M COMPUTING "A & M Computing"
Reviews.Content: I ordered this foscam 9dbi antenna for a relatively difficult installation. Due to the environment we were getting very intermittent signals from 3 cameras. I ordered 1 of these just to try them despite some of the reviews. Well.... the antenna does provide a limited increase in reception but even so just no way this is 9dbi increase.

Reviews.Title: Wireless Range Antenna Expander For Foscam FI8918 IP Camera
Reviews.Author: Paul Harshman
Reviews.Content: I'm using this antenna on the Foscam FI8910W IP Camera's. sometimes it works wonders, improving the wireless performance by leaps and bounds. other times a home made antenna extension made from stainless steel wire and applied to the original antenna out preforms it by a large margin

Reviews.Title: Stopped my camera from sporadically dropping out of site.
Reviews.Author: Jhon "Jhon"
Reviews.Content: I had one camera at the far corner of my house that would at times, disappear from my list of cameras. I purchased this mixed review antenna figuring I had a 50/50 chance of solving my problem. Well the camera has not gone missing from my list since I put it on the camera. I really did not see the specs of this antenna anywhere and it is a lot longer than I assume, (15 inches). The only issue (others mentioned it) is that you can not tighten it enough to stop it from drooping the threads stop too soon. Major design flaw. I was able to get mine to stand up with a little finagling. Bottom line, it did what I needed it to do.

Reviews.Title: Does not work for IP8904W Outdoor Wireless Camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I purchased this hoping it would work as a wireless range extender for an outdoor camera.  However, it is not made to fit to the one I purchased, and to date, I haven't found one that will fit the outdoor camera.  I'd love to hear if someone else has run into this problem or found one.  I'm sure it's a great product for the indoor cameras; unfortunately, I did not need to extend my wireless inside.

Reviews.Title: Huge
Reviews.Author: MEDISIN
Reviews.Content: Much bigger than pictures suggest.  Works well at boosting signal but impossible to use on outdoor models without dremeling the threaded portion a bit.

Reviews.Title: A must have for connection problems
Reviews.Author: K. Dobson
Reviews.Content: If you can't connect dependably and your settings are correct, this is the fix. I run 6 cameras. 3 of them were intermittently going offline. They were either too far from the router or had too many walls to go through. The big antenna fixed the problem.

Reviews.Title: Does not work at all. Literally does not function.
Reviews.Author: William A. Ryan
Reviews.Content: I had to put the stock antenna back on the camera after messing with this DOA antenna. It literally does not work. A total waste of money. Do not purchase.

Reviews.Title: Foscam Cameras
Reviews.Author: maxie
Reviews.Content: Good product. BEST!! customer service. I bought 5 of these and could not get them working. Tina at foscam went through every step and had them up and working in no time. She was a real customer service professional and i teach it at the college level so I know what to look for.

Reviews.Title: Okay, probably wouldn't buy again
Reviews.Author: JWheeler
Reviews.Content: The antenna does appear to help with the connection, but not the level of improvement that I was looking for.

Reviews.Title: Works
Reviews.Author: M.F.C. Cheaters
Reviews.Content: This Antenna definitely boosted the range of my Foscam FI8910W Camera.  I have my camera some distance away from my router and experienced occasional drop-outs, since installing the extender I have eliminated the problem.

Reviews.Title: won't take returns
Reviews.Author: Jill
Reviews.Content: The coax broke on both antennas not long after we bought them, and Foscam would not take them back. We could barely understand the operators(Chuck) English. They also wouldn't take back 2 cables that we bought that weren't the right size for the cameras we had. I had to build 2 cables for and outside system.

Reviews.Title: Don't bother, it doesn't work!
Reviews.Author: lakelife
Reviews.Content: This was an unfortunate purchase.  It is basically worthless.  It did not increase the signal from the wifi, The antennae would not stay in an upward stance, it would just fall down but it didn't matter because upright or not, it didn't work.  I ended up giving it away as I thought it wasn't worth the money to return it.

Reviews.Title: Might be useful.
Reviews.Author: Jake Barnes
Reviews.Content: Does not hold itself up like one would think. Might be best to use the smaller one. In my opinion.

Reviews.Title: Antenna
Reviews.Author: headwrench
Reviews.Content: Had a weak signal, so I ordered this extended antenna that suppose to triple the signal, it was worse, I put my short antenna back on, and now I'm back to getting less timed out & black screens like I used to, my IP cam is also junk, Foscam # F18918W.

Reviews.Title: Range Extender Antenna
Reviews.Author: Lou Stafford
Reviews.Content: The larger "loaded" antenna increases the signal somewhat; how much is debatable but in a fringe situation it would fill the need....

Reviews.Title: Poor product description
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I did buy it for an external camera as nothing pointed out this would not work for these type of camaras, however this antenna is not working for them.

Reviews.Title: More than satisfied with performance
Reviews.Author: RJL "RJ"
Reviews.Content: I bought this to use with my Foscam FI8918W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens. I was having distance issues and not able to get a link with my Fios Westell Router. After attaching this Expander I saw instant results. I essentially doubled my range. Please take note. Your link will not just instantly connect. You will have to experiment a little to see what works for you. What I mean is start the camera first or run the software first. In my case I plugged in the power adapter to the camera and then ran the IP Camera software tool. It will take a while for the link to establish. Be patient. Also you might experience some latency between the software controls for pan and tilt and the camera the futher the distance. Obstructions, walls, other RF devices in your area will also contribute to your performance. I'll end with it has worked for me. Reasonable price. Very fast shipping.

Reviews.Title: Foscam 9dbi Antenna Range Extender
Reviews.Author: Doug Heyen
Reviews.Content: Product works great.  Have a significant increase in the signal and reliability of the video.  Better signal=more frames per second.  Also a lot less interruptions in the signal.  If you are still having problems after changing these antennas, just remember that the router hasn't had its antenna changed.  No matter what type antenna you put on the camera if the router cant reach it with a quality signal, the camera wont improve its signal much.  Most routers have built in antenna. The one to use would be a router with an upgradeable antenna!  Thanks for the quality products at a reasonable price! Doug

Reviews.Title: Solved my problem
Reviews.Author: Nick M
Reviews.Content: I was having an issue with my foscam 8910 randomly loosing wireless connection. I installed this long antenna and it seemed to fix the problem. i was able to lay the antenna down on the surface the camera is resting on too.. the antenna is extremely long and looks weird when its standing up. laying it down it seemed to still work fine.. did i mention its LONG.. yeah.. it's LONG

Reviews.Title: big and heavy but does what I expected
Reviews.Author: Gene Waldvogle
Reviews.Content: These expander antennas do what I want, but they will not hold themselves in a position without help.  Fortunately, I was able to use them in a position where gravity is all that is needed.  Definitely improved the camera connectivity over wifi.

Reviews.Title: dissapointing
Reviews.Author: John D. Canoles
Reviews.Content: Did not appear to extend my range and they are so long they won't support themselves by staying upright. It appears to have been a waste of money.

Reviews.Title: Seems to be ok
Reviews.Author: Ken Dreger
Reviews.Content: Little loose at the connection, flops over when upright.....maybe some additional adjustment in making these would help.  Have used others and they did not have the same problem

Reviews.Title: works well for more range
Reviews.Author: Whatmorecanyousay "Bob"
Reviews.Content: but not a double range bump as claimed.great for remote cams far from the router so thatframe rate jumps a few frames per second.If you are thinking of extending your rangegetting a router range extender might be better.It does work however without the cost of a range extender.If you are not already gettgin getting a signal it might not meet your needs but for the priceits worth a try. The brand is very well made line of PTz CAMS FOR THE PRICE!

Reviews.Title: Poor product
Reviews.Author: Douglas Linville
Reviews.Content: I read the previous reviews with a grain of salt and figured that the naysayers simply are outspoken and trashing a product they don't know how to get to work. Boy, was I wrong. As metioned, this unit DOES NOT FIT the FI8906 without modifications. You must grind down the outer surface of the device so that it will fit and properly tighten into the camera. However, after modified, the inner threads came unglued out of the antenna. JB Weld fixed that problem with great care not to interfere with connection/conductivity. With the device ready, it was attached and absolutely no visible improvement was noted. Maybe parameters on signal quality read on my base station were slightly better—I went from -81dB to -79dB. But no reception/transmission difference. As stated, the antenna with the camera worked much better from all aspects.DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT

Reviews.Title: Don't waste your money!
Reviews.Author: T. Pugh "B1GTED"
Reviews.Content: This item is huge and it doesn't do anything!  It works exactly the same as the original antenna that came with the Foscam Camera. It did absolutely nothing.

Reviews.Title: Does not improve wifi reception
Reviews.Author: Patrick Yi
Reviews.Content: I tried but this didn’t improve my wifi reception at all. Opted to get another wifi extender instead after all.

Reviews.Title: i bit long but does the trick.
Reviews.Author: Sharee Rivera "sharita"
Reviews.Content: had to mount my camera outside and away from the router.  this antenna, though a bit cumbersome, works perfectly.  my advise is to try it before you decide on a mounting spot.

Reviews.Title: WASTE OF MONEY
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: elbow is loose and sloppy. doesn't work. camera works better with no antenna than with it. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY ON THIS PIECE OF JUNK!I thought at first it was just too far from my primary router. turns out its just a crappy antenna.

Reviews.Title: Terrible Product
Reviews.Author: I. T. Hassan "Itarek"
Reviews.Content: there is no difference with this antenna and the regular one i think its less it is less with this antenna

Reviews.Title: HELPS WITH PICTURE QTY.
Reviews.Author: GrammeC
Reviews.Content: I THINK IT HELPED WITH A BETTER  PICTURE, MOTHER IS ON BASEMENT AND I AM 2 FLOORS UP. AND IT WORKING GREAT!

Reviews.Title: Works!
Reviews.Author: T.
Reviews.Content: I have a Foscam Camera that monitors my front door / front yard / driveway area and it would occasionally lose signal when using the standard antenna that came with the camera.  After installing this expander (simply unscrew the old antenna and screw this one on), my signal issues are gone!

Reviews.Title: It doesnt work with every foscam camera.
Reviews.Author: nitevision eyes
Reviews.Content: I recently bought a foscam camera but in the process of installation, the antenna broke so I thought this one will be a good replacement as they said it fits in all the foscam cameras. The item was not as specified and as the shipping charges are too high, I am stuck with it.

Reviews.Title: Get These - And Aim The Pancake...
Reviews.Author: Kerton
Reviews.Content: Stop thinking about it. If you have a indoor Foscam, and you are spending the time worrying about signal strength, and you have invested your time, money, and wishes on the cameras, just get these antennae for EVERY one of your cams. Here's why:Unless the Foscam is in the same room as the router, an IP cam puts a lot of strain on your WiFi. Unlike web pages or email, a cam streams video, video is high bandwidth, and if you're storing your video on a PC (usin Blue Iris software, for example) the cam is streaming 24x7. Add a few more cams, and that's a lot of bandwidth.As your wifi channel becomes slightly congested, and your signal strength is not ideal, the cameras start dropping data packets, and trying to re-send, and then conflicting with the other cameras which all want to send their video NOW! Stronger signal avoids the lost packets and the resends. Use these, or even better, run Ethernet cable. You won't believe how much better the cameras work on Ethernet.By running all upgraded antennae, you will get better framerates from all cams, more reliable connections, the ability to have more cams on the same wifi network, fewer crashes, fewer bugs, faster PTZ response, etc. That's true even if your system works just fine with the shorties.Here's the downside, which is manageable: these antennas aren't magic. They don't make your signal stronger, they just change the aim of the signal. With the shorter stock 3dbi pole antenna, picture a big donut around the tip of the antenna. That is where your signal goes. Now, with this longer 9dbi pole antenna, picture a flat pancake around the tip of the antenna. That is where your signal goes with this unit. That means you have to aim the antenna in such a way that the wifi AP is on a plane perpendicular to the antenna. If your Foscam is one floor above your WiFi, this antenna will make your signal WORSE if you keep the antenna straight up, and don't "aim the pancake".

Reviews.Title: Antennae very loose
Reviews.Author: Eric D. Chavez
Reviews.Content: Definitely not happy with this product.  Antennae will stay not stay in position and falls over.  There is no discernible way to tighten it

Reviews.Title: Would not fit into the housing
Reviews.Author: val brown
Reviews.Content: This antenna would not clear the housing on the Foscam FI8904W.  I had to use a dremel tool to grind down the outside of the connector  in order to engage the connector threads.  I don't know how it performs as I am using the antenna that cam with the camera.

Reviews.Title: Works
Reviews.Author: Cooper M Shay
Reviews.Content: Does its job just fine, but unfortunately it's so heavy that it will not stand up, as others have said before.

Reviews.Title: Really helps Foscam cameras.
Reviews.Author: Max B. Turner "skyyabsolute"
Reviews.Content: Foscam should make these standard. I have several wireless cams around the house for security. Adding the gain from this antenna brought my furthest camera into the network.

Reviews.Title: Great help
Reviews.Author: mecurtis
Reviews.Content: Bought into extend the range of my Foscam FI8910 and 821HD cameras. Can't complain but the stock antenna will do for most set ups. Try the stock antenna before buying the extended antenna.

Reviews.Title: Worse than the original
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey LeBlanc
Reviews.Content: I have three (3) fi8910w's and my asus router rt-n65u connects to the 9 dbi antenna @ 13Mb as opposed to the antenna that came with the camera (3dbi) @ 65Mb. The camera tested is about 40ft from router and is outside, separated by 3 walls(one brick wall). Complete waste of money! From my experience, the original antenna is superior and all that is needed.

Reviews.Title: Worse than the stock antenna
Reviews.Author: Ld81
Reviews.Content: I could at least get some signal with the stock antenna. With this antenna I pick up nothing. This was a total waste of money.  Buyer beware!

Reviews.Title: These things stink
Reviews.Author: William A. Yeager
Reviews.Content: Don't waste your money on these things. They do not do anything for the cameraq which I might ad is a piece of junk also.

ProductInfo.Features: Foscam Wireless Range 9dbi Antenna Expander for Foscam IP Camera
ProductInfo.Name: Foscam Wireless Range 9dbi Antenna Expander for Foscam IP Camera - Black
